org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task

Class JavaTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task.CommonAttribute
      • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task.Task
        • org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task.JavaTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    @PublicAPI
public class JavaTask
extends Task
    Use this class to build a java task that will use a JavaExecutable and be integrated in a TaskFlowJob.

    A java task includes an JavaExecutable that can be set as a .class file or instance.

    It also provides method to personalize it.

    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 0.9
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setExecutableClassName

        public void setExecutableClassName(String executableClassName)
        To set the executable task class name. It must be a class that extends JavaExecutable.
        Parameters:
        executableClassName - the task Class to set.

      • getArguments

        public Map<String,Serializable> getArguments()
                                      throws IOException,
                                             ClassNotFoundException
        Return an unmodifiable copy of all the task arguments as a hash map.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable copy of the arguments list.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the copy of the value cannot be performed.
        ClassNotFoundException - if the value's class cannot be loaded.

      • getSerializedArguments

        public HashMap<String,byte[]> getSerializedArguments()

      • addArgument

        public void addArgument(String name,
                        Serializable value)
        Add an argument to the list of arguments. Note that the value is serialized and stored in the JavaTask.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the argument to add.
        value - the associated value to add.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value cannot be serialized and stored in the task.
